intro: Premna pallescens, commonly known as the pale premna, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a pale green coloration. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are followed by small, round berries. Premna pallescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
